ai-mn53:1.2_0: at one time the Fortunate One was dwelling amongst the Sakyas, near to Kapilavatthu, in Nigrodha’s Monastery.
ai-mn53:2.1_0: Now at that time a new town hall had recently been constructed for the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu. It had not yet been occupied by an ascetic or brahmin or any person at all.
ai-mn53:2.2_0: Then the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu went to the Fortunate One,
ai-mn53:2.2_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-mn53:2.2_2: While sitting on one side the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-mn53:2.3_0: “Sir, a new town hall has recently been constructed for the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu. It has not yet been occupied by an ascetic or brahmin or any person at all.
ai-mn53:2.4_0: May the Buddha be the first to use it,
ai-mn53:2.4_1: and only then will the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu use it.
ai-mn53:2.5_0: That would be for the lasting welfare and happiness of the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu.”
ai-mn53:3.1_0: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.
ai-mn53:3.2_0: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, the Sakyans got up from their seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right.
ai-mn53:3.2_1: and after going, spreading a mattress, spread out a seat, and placed it on the lamps, they went to the Buddha,
ai-mn53:3.4_0: and told him of their preparations, saying,
ai-mn53:3.5_0: “Venerable Sir, all the seats have been spread out; a blade covered with water and water jars are ready,
ai-mn53:3.6_0: adding, “Sir, please come at your convenience.”
ai-mn53:4.1_0: Then the Buddha robed up and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the new town hall together with the Saṅgha of mendicants.
ai-mn53:4.1_1: Having washed his feet, he entered the town hall, and sat against the central column facing east,
ai-mn53:4.2_0: The Saṅgha of mendicants also washed their feet, entered the town hall, and sat against the west wall facing east, with the Buddha right in front of them.
ai-mn53:4.3_0: The Sakyans of Kapilavatthu also washed their feet, entered the town hall, and sat against the east wall facing west, with the Buddha right in front of them.
ai-mn53:5.1_0: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the Sakyans with a Dhamma talk. Then he addressed Venerable Ānanda,
ai-mn53:5.2_0: “Ānanda, speak about the practicing trainee to the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu as you feel inspired.
ai-mn53:5.6_0: And then the Buddha spread out his outer robe folded in four and laid down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up.
ai-mn53:6.1_0: Then Ānanda addressed Mahānāma the Sakyan:
ai-mn53:6.2_0: “Mahānāma, a noble disciple is accomplished in ethics, guards the sense doors, eats in moderation, and is dedicated to wakefulness. They have seven good qualities, and they get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-mn53:7.1_0: And how is a noble disciple accomplished in ethics?
ai-mn53:7.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-mn53:7.3_0: That’s how a noble disciple is ethical.
ai-mn53:8.1_0: And how does a noble disciple guard the sense doors?
ai-mn53:8.2_0: When a noble disciple sees a sight with their eyes, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-mn53:8.3_0: If the faculty of sight were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming. For this reason, they practice restraint, protecting the faculty of sight, and achieving its restraint.
ai-mn53:8.4_0: When you hear a sound with your ears ...
ai-mn53:8.5_0: Smelling an odor with the nose ...
ai-mn53:8.6_0: tastes a flavor with the tongue ...
ai-mn53:8.7_0: feels an agreeable touch with the body ...
ai-mn53:8.8_0: Knowing a thought with their mind, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-mn53:8.9_0: If the faculty of mind were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming. For this reason, they practice restraint, protecting the faculty of mind, and achieving its restraint.
ai-mn53:8.10_0: That’s how a noble disciple guards the sense doors.
ai-mn53:9.1_0: And how does a noble disciple eat in moderation?
ai-mn53:9.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple reflects properly on the food that they eat:
ai-mn53:9.3_0: ‘Not for sport, or for showing off, not for ornament,
ai-mn53:9.3_1: but only to maintain this body, to avoid harm, and to support spiritual life.
ai-mn53:9.3_2: In this way, I shall put an end to old discomfort and not give rise to new discomfort, and I will live blamelessly and at ease.’
ai-mn53:9.4_0: That’s how a noble disciple eats in moderation.
ai-mn53:10.1_0: And how is a noble disciple dedicated to wakefulness?
ai-mn53:10.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple practices walking and sitting meditation by day, purifying their mind from obstacles.
ai-mn53:10.3_0: In the evening, they continue to practice walking and sitting meditation.
ai-mn53:10.4_0: In the middle of the night, they lie down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up.
ai-mn53:10.5_0: In the last part of the night, they get up and continue to practice walking and sitting meditation, purifying their mind from obstacles.
ai-mn53:10.6_0: That’s how a noble disciple is dedicated to wakefulness.
ai-mn53:11.1_0: And how does a noble disciple have seven good qualities?
ai-mn53:11.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple has faith in the Realized One’s awakening ...
ai-mn53:11.3_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-mn53:12.1_0: They have a conscience. They’re conscientious about bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and conscientious about having any bad, unskillful qualities.
ai-mn53:13.1_0: They exercise prudence. They’re prudent when it comes to bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and prudent when it comes to acquiring any bad, unskillful qualities.
ai-mn53:14.1_0: They’re very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned.
ai-mn53:15.1_0: They live with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They’re strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.
ai-mn53:16.1_0: They’re mindful. They have utmost mindfulness and alertness, and can remember and recall what was said and done long ago.
ai-mn53:17.1_0: They’re wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-mn53:17.2_0: That’s how a noble disciple has seven good qualities.
ai-mn53:18.1_0: And how does a noble disciple get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty?
ai-mn53:18.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption ...
ai-mn53:18.4_0: And with the fading away of rapture, they enter and remain in the third absorption, where they meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’
ai-mn53:18.5_1: dwells having attained the fourth absorption.
ai-mn53:18.6_0: That’s how a noble disciple gets the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-mn53:19.1_0: When a noble disciple is practicing all these things they are called a noble disciple who is a practicing trainee. Their eggs are unspoiled, and they are capable of breaking out of their shell, becoming awakened, and achieving the supreme sanctuary.
ai-mn53:19.2_0: Suppose there was a chicken with eight or ten or twelve eggs. And she properly sat on them to keep them warm and incubated. Even if that chicken doesn’t wish,
ai-mn53:19.3_0: ‘If only my chicks could break out of the eggshell with their claws and beak and hatch safely!’
ai-mn53:19.4_0: But still they can break out and hatch safely.
ai-mn53:19.5_0: In the same way, when a noble disciple is practicing all these things they are called a noble disciple who is a practicing trainee. Their eggs are unspoiled, and they are capable of breaking out of their shell, becoming awakened, and achieving the supreme sanctuary.
ai-mn53:20.1_0: Relying on this supreme purity of mindfulness and equanimity, that noble disciple recollects their many kinds of past lives.
ai-mn53:20.2_1: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-mn53:20.3_0: This is their first breaking out, like a chick from an eggshell.
ai-mn53:21.1_0: Relying on this supreme purity of mindfulness and equanimity, that noble disciple, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn ...
ai-mn53:21.1_1: and he knows beings arise according to their (good and bad) actions...
ai-mn53:21.2_0: This is their second breaking out, like a chick from an eggshell.
ai-mn53:22.1_0: Relying on this supreme purity of mindfulness and equanimity, that noble disciple realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-mn53:22.2_0: This is their third breaking out, like a chick from an eggshell.
ai-mn53:23.1_0: A noble disciple’s conduct includes the following: being accomplished in ethics,
ai-mn53:23.3_0: and when a noble disciple eats in moderation,
ai-mn53:23.6_0: and getting the four absorptions when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-mn53:24.1_0: A noble disciple’s knowledge includes the following: recollecting their past lives,
ai-mn53:24.1_1: When they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-mn53:24.2_0: clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman,
ai-mn53:24.2_1: They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-mn53:24.3_0: and having realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-mn53:25.1_0: This noble disciple is said to be ‘accomplished in knowledge’, and also ‘accomplished in conduct’, and also ‘accomplished in knowledge and conduct’.
ai-mn53:25.2_0: Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra also spoke this verse:
ai-mn53:25.4_0: who take clan as the standard.
ai-mn53:25.5_0: But one accomplished in knowledge and conduct
ai-mn53:25.6_0: is first among gods and humans.’
ai-mn53:25.7_0: And that verse was well sung by Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra, not poorly sung; well spoken, not poorly spoken, beneficial, not harmful, and it was approved by the Buddha.”
ai-mn53:26.1_0: Then the Buddha got up and said to Venerable Ānanda,
ai-mn53:26.3_0: It’s good that you’ve missed the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu.”
ai-mn53:26.4_0: This is what Venerable Ānanda said,
ai-mn53:26.6_0: Satisfied, the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu were happy with what Venerable Ānanda said.
ai-mn53:26.7_0: The third chapter on trainees is finished.
